item.title: Report X-2025070002
item.description:
Report X-2025070002

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-30
  • City: HILLSBORO
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING GROUND PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 32 OUNCE PLASTIC BOTTLE OF CORROSIVE BATTERY FLUID ACID LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. INNER BOX MARKED AND LABELED UN2796 BATTERY FLUID ACID WITH CLASS 8 DOT DIAMOND LABEL. NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING SHIPPER NUMBER K100A6, MFN-AMAZON, 333 108TH AVE NE, BELLEVUE WA 98004-5703.

item.title: Report E-2025070204
item.description:
Report E-2025070204

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-30
  • City: UMATILLA
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 30, 2205, one (1) 158-gallon tote of UN3082 was punctured in transit and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel utilized absorbents, cleaners, and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The contents of the damaged tote were transferred into one (1) new 275-gallon tote. One (1) gaylord box and one (1) 55-gallon drum that contained any spent absorbents, the cut-up poly tote, and any cleanup debris were staged onsite.

item.title: Report E-2025060426
item.description:
Report E-2025060426

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-19
  • City: Portland
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Don's Mobile Wash
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Carrier was operating a rented box truck with a GVWR of 25,999 in interstate commerce. Carrier had purchased 26 drums from NW Auto Solutions of reported Hydrofluoric Acid in 55 gallon plastic drums. Carrier reported they did not have shipping papers for the load. Carrier was travelling NB on I-205 in Portland when they reported they were cut off in traffic, left the highway, and collided with the trailer of a flat-bed trailer which was stopped on the shoulder. The box truck sidewall was penetrated by the flat-bed, resulting in the damage of one of the drums. The entire contents of the drum leaked out onto the highway, resulting in a complete highway closure. Initial law enforcement responders reported some airway discomfort. One responded was evaluated at a local ER a day after. Portland Fire Bureau's Hazmat response team applied absorbent and mitigated the leak. It is unknown if any of the material leaked into the waterway. Carrier was hauling without a hazmat endorsed CDL, no placards, no shipping papers, and no emergency response information. USDOT inspection was completed and documented under inspection number ORAL41131179. Carrier was advised to report to NRC. Reported contacted NRC on 6/21/25 and discovered no report was made. Reporter then made report to NRC.

item.title: Report X-2025061975
item.description:
Report X-2025061975

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-19
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the PDXR location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered twelve cans of spray paint inside. One can was damaged releasing its contents inside of the fiberboard box. There were no DG markings or paperwork in the outer fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2025060456
item.description:
Report E-2025060456

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-29
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 20:53 PM ET, UPO contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Portland, OR. The spill consists of approximately 5 ounces of Houghto-Deox A-1714, which released from (1) 5-gallon metal drum due to not being properly strapped in prior to arrival, causing the material to spill out onto the trailer floor. The caller stated there may be other containers impacted as well. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist as this is a 5.1 material. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of UN1505 Houghto-Deox A-1714 product released to the wooden trailer floor due to load shift. The contractors swept up the product and reported (3) of the pails were damaged. They generated (1) 55-gallon poly drum containing the damaged 5-gallon pails and floor sweepings. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
